page.title: 13TRADE - NORTH CREAKE
page.content: There is a self-service food store in the village centre, which sells daily news-papers and arranges their delivery in this and the neighbouring village. The sub post office also stocks some food items and has an agency for a dry-cleaning service. In a room behind the post office is a hair-dressing salon. The village has one public house which provides bar snacks. The dis-used school buildings house a company manufacturing 3-dimensional wooden jig-saw puzzles which are exported world-side. Other buildings which had been redundant are occupied by a firm of craftsmen manufacturing fitted kitchens and pine furniture, with occasional art exhibitions by a local artist. The only other trader in the village is a plumber who employs two men.
